newsitem.title: CHINA: China defense chief blasts 'China threat' theory.
newsitem.headline: China defense chief blasts 'China threat' theory.

text.p: China's Defense Minister, Chi Haotian, on Wednesday dismissed the idea that Beijing posed a threat to other nations and said any attempt to contain or isolate China would fail.

"Some Western countries view China from a wrong perspective and spread the 'China threat' fallacy in an attempt to contain or isolate China," Chi said in a meeting with Australian armed forces chief John Baker.
"China should not be contained or isolated, and such a policy will not succeed," the official Xinhua news agency quoted Chi as telling Baker, in Beijing on an official visit.
Beijing is deeply suspicious that Western countries, most notably the United States, are pursuing a strategy of trying to contain China's economic and military rise.

Washington denies it fears China's ascension to the world stage, saying it upholds a policy of engagement towards Beijing. But some U.S. officials have said a need to contain China may arise in the future.
Chi said Beijing was willing to hold dialogues and forge friendly ties with other nations while reserving differences.

"Development of friendly relations and cooperation between China and Australia...will not only benefit the two countries but will be conducive to peace in the region and the world as a whole," Chi said.
Beijing's ties with Canberra have taken a chilly plunge since Australian Prime Minister John Howard announced he would meet exiled Tibetan leader the Dalai Lama on Thursday.

While Australia has been eager to play down the visit, Beijing, which regards the Dalai Lama as a pro-independence campaigner bent on splitting China, has hinted at possible political and trade reprisals.
